titleStmt.title: Cambridge, St John's College, MS K.49

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, St John's College, MS K.49

summary.seg: This manuscript contains a large collection of medical, practical, cosmetic, and culinary recipes in Middle English and Latin. Among these are also a large number of charms for healing purposes and driving vermin away. The manuscript also contains texts with dietary instructions, prognostications, and medical diagnosis through urine and humours, and a tract on establishing whether the medical cause for unwanted childlessness in a couple lies with the man or the woman. Among the more striking texts in this manuscript is a detailed instruction in Middle English for making a bath on f. 80v.

Dr Clarck Drieshen
Project Cataloguer
Cambridge University Library

msItem.title: A table of contents to the manuscript's collection of recipes
msItem.rubric: 1r [H]ic incipit kalendarium medicinarum [de modo ope]rande en curandi diuersas Infirm[itates infra] humanum corpus existentes et de modeo con[...]-nas predictas provt patet in capitulis s[...] quedam notabilia patent in quodam collec[...] decurrencia - In primis
msItem.incipit: 1r ffor ache of the hedde. Item. - Capitulo primo [...] folio .i.o
msItem.explicit: 5v ffor to stanche blode - Collect. fo. iiijto. a.
msItem.note: The table of contents is divided into fourteen chapters: 1. brain 2. eyes 3. ears 4. face 5. mouth 6. throat 7. chest 8. abdomen 9. skin 10. reproductive organs 11. swellings 12. legs and feet 13. Palsy and gout 14. blood and poison.

msItem.title: Collection of medical recipes and charms
msItem.rubric: 5v Primum Capitulum - Hic inciipit primum capitulum medicinarum de modo operandi et curandi diuersas in firmitates infra humanum corpus existentes. Primo secuntur medince propter dolorem capitis
msItem.incipit: 5v ffor ache of the hedde . Take rewe hayhoye . bay leuys . And sethe them to gethers yn whyte wyne other yn water
msItem.explicit: 42v Item ad idem / Take the juse of femytorye and drynke hit with stale ale at eve and a morowe and it helpith and curyth
msItem.note: The text is divided in fourteen sections with Latin headings, as stated in the table of contents, but continuous without break with further recipes and charms not included in the table of contents.

msItem.title: Charm for cleansing the head
msItem.rubric: 7r Item ad idem sequitur carmen
msItem.incipit: 7r Caput domini nostri ihesu Christi Amen
msItem.explicit: 7v Jhesus mercy amen

msItem.title: Charm to clear the eyes
msItem.rubric: 12v A goode Charme for the hew yn mannys yee
msItem.incipit: 12v + In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti . Amen.
msItem.explicit: 12v In + nomine . nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti Amen
msItem.finalRubric: 12v This charme most be sayde iij tymys ouer the yee and euery tyme a Pater noster and Aue . and vrete thys charme yn a strawe

msItem.title: Charm against toothache
msItem.rubric: 7r Item carmen pro dolore dencium
msItem.incipit: 7r Scribe in maxilla pacientis cum encausto . hec nomina contra malum + pax + nax + tax + in Christo filio virginis + sistimus + Et dicatur a scriptore . Pater noster Aue maria . Credo in deum etcaetera

msItem.title: Charm against warts
msItem.rubric: 7r Item ad idem
msItem.incipit: 7r A charme when that the pryst ys at the masse and knyth forthwarde and seythe these wordes / Dominus vobiscum / Say thow also . Trewly soo fall adowne all the virtys of this man N. thorow the virtu of þe fader and sone and holygost . and say a pater noster . and an Ave. and a crede.

msItem.title: Charm against pain
msItem.rubric: 40r A gode medycyne for the axes / and a trew
msItem.incipit: 40r Take iij oblettis of gyngyr brede and make iij crossis yn the smothe syde . and wrete yn the same syde iij. namys
msItem.explicit: 40v And also wrete these name y parchment + a + g + l + a + and bynd hit to his leche fynger of the ryght honde and lett hit be there iij. dayis . Et sanabitur cum gracia dei

msItem.title: Charm for staunching blood
msItem.rubric: 41r Item for all maner of bledyng
msItem.incipit: 41r Take a penne and vrete this worde with hys owen blode yn hys fore hedde for a man + Beronix + and for a woman + Beronixa + and hit shall stanche the blode sone after that hit ys drye by the grace of godde

msItem.title: Charm for stopping menstrual flow
msItem.rubric: 42v Contra fluxum mulieris
msItem.incipit: 42v Scribe hec et sub pectore ligabis et sanabitur. Quod si non credis in cultello scribe et occide cum porcellum vel aliud animal et sanguis non effluet .p.k.b.x.[],o.x.a.o.l.b.y.z.l.B.

msItem.title: Two charms for staunching nosebleeds
msItem.rubric: 42v ffor to stanche blode att the nose
msItem.incipit: 42v Take rewe and stampe hit small and put it yn to the nose. Item ad idem: Take a penne and wrte these wordys with the same blode: O + phi. li. ti. me .te. +

msItem.title: Charm to make hair grow
msItem.incipit: 43r Item in fronte masculi scribe / Biron . birona . femine vero / Biron Bironixa

msItem.title: Charm for childbirth
msItem.rubric: 44r Sequitur carmen
msItem.incipit: 44r In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti . Amen
msItem.explicit: 44r tenet opera rotas + amen + amen + amen

msItem.title: Charm against animal pests in mammals
msItem.rubric: 46v Camen pro peste animalium et dicatur a presbitero sub stola
msItem.incipit: 46v Oracio: dominus vobiscum et cum spiritu tuo
msItem.explicit: 46v Et aspergatur aqua benedicta super pabula et dentur animalibus

msItem.title: Charm for staunching blood
msItem.rubric: 47r Item ad idem
msItem.incipit: 47r Longius miles latus domini nostri Jhesu Christi lancea perforauit et continuo exunt sanguis et aqua in redempcionem nostrorum
msItem.explicit: 47r Et dicatur Pater noster et Aue maria et Credo

msItem.title: Charm against the falling sickness
msItem.incipit: 61r Pro morbo caduco. Whan the malyncholy commyth to hym and he ys fall a downe say these wordes with goode entent yn hys yere [anazapta]. ons or iiij. tymys oþer .iiij. tymys or more

msItem.title: Charm for healing a dog's bite
msItem.rubric: 63r ffor bytynge of a wode hounde whether hit be man or best
msItem.incipit: 63r Wrete the namys yn swyche thynge as he maye ete + guare + frare + guare + frare + guare + frare + guare + frare + and lett hym ete hit . and he schall be save by the helpe of goode.

msItem.title: Charm for driving out mice and rats
msItem.rubric: 64v Medicina ad mures et ratones fugandos . Pater noster . dicitur ter in nomine sancte Trinitatis in domo seu grangia cum carmen isto
msItem.incipit: 65r Sanctus Karisius seruus dei ab infancia sua a domibus matris sue per virtutem sancte trinitatis et per virtutem sancte crucis omnes mures et ratones fugauit et per intercessionem sancti karisii omnes mures et ratones fugiant de doma ista vt grangia
msItem.explicit: 65r Accipe iiij.or lapides crete permentaree et scribe illos nomina euangelistarum. Marcus + Matheus + Lucas + Johannes. et super .Johannem. Scribe Alpha. + et oo + et super alios lapides et pone illos .iiij.or lapides super angulos domus cum iiij.or Pater noster

msItem.title: Charm for women in labour
msItem.rubric: 65v Si mulier laborat in partu dic in dextera aure
msItem.incipit: 65v Qui dicunt exinanite exinanite vsque ad fundamentum in ea.
msItem.explicit: 65v ix vicibus dic hunc versum et reuertere te et dic ix. Pater noster

msItem.title: Charm against the falling sickness
msItem.rubric: 65v Pro morbo caduco
msItem.incipit: 65v Take the blode of his lytell fynger and vrete þerwith yn parchement and honge hit a bowte his necke + Jaspar fert aurum thus Melchyor attropa mirram + hic quicumque triusecum fert nomina regum soluitur a morbo domini pietate cadus

msItem.title: Charm against cramp
msItem.rubric: 66r Item pro eodem dic ista verba
msItem.incipit: 66r Goba . Goma . Gomera.

msItem.title: Collection of medical recipes and charms
msItem.incipit: 41v Contra fluxum mulieris
msItem.explicit: 54r et secundum fac puluerem adde [ounce] uct. must.

msItem.title: Dietary recipes
msItem.incipit: 54r Nunc parum dicamus de proprietatibus cirobum et primo de butiro: Take butter a letell and vsed dothe goode to the pynttes and moche vsed dothe grete hurte to the stomake for hit natyth yn the somake and makyth yndygestioun
msItem.explicit: 57v Also yf that aman haue ete . rawe mete . lett hym ete a grete rowe onyoun of iij. with salt and hit schall dystroye the venym and the corrupcyoun . and saue the man oþer woman wheþer soo hit be of both

msItem.title: Tract on the virtues of rosemary
msItem.rubric: 57v Nunc de virtutibus rose marine iam declaramus
msItem.incipit: 57v Take the flowres of rose maryn and bray hem yn a morter but lytell and bynd hem yn a feyre lynnyn cloth sum whatte large and seth hem well yn water ynto haluen dele . and yeff the drynke and þat is goode for all evellys
msItem.explicit: 59r And lett the seke vse .ij. sponefull of þys medycyn with vj. sponefull of stale ale warme both fyrst and last . tyll he be hoole . Probatum est.

msItem.title: Prognostications for the day of the week on which Christmas falls
msItem.rubric: 57v Si dies natalis domini sit
msItem.incipit: 57v Dies dominica: A grete wynter a good somer . and moche corne and freutes and deth of chyldryne and of prestys and perelys fyghtynge and many thevys . and love of knyghtys
msItem.explicit: 59v Die sabbati: A [crossed out: goode] \ wynde / wynter a stormy somer a good heruest perell of fyere and few fowelys . meny foxes . deth of olde men and heeye

msItem.title: Prognostications for the month of the year in which it thunders
msItem.rubric: 59v De prognosticacionibus tonitrium secundum cursum xij mensuum
msItem.incipit: 59v Januarie: Betokenyth werre and stryffe of lordes and yn all the worlde moche woo . and soo sayth Idres the prophete and grete floodys and wrakys
msItem.explicit: 60r Decembre: Betokenyth grete wyndys and floodys moche frewte and moche love and peas yn londe.
msItem.finalRubric: 60r Quod nobis concedat qui viuit et regnat per omnia secular seculorum Amen

msItem.title: Practical recipes
msItem.incipit: 60r ffor to make fyes fle fro a mannys howse . Take the juce of veruayne and temper hit with holy water þat ys newe blessyd and spryng it a bowte the wallys and the flyes shall voyde
msItem.explicit: 61r than take a fether and lay mater apone the sayde wrytyng and lett it be
msItem.note: The recipes include methods for tempering vinegar with a Flemish stone tile, killing rats, capturing moles, and writing on iron

msItem.title: Collection of medical and culinary recipes
msItem.incipit: 61r Pro morbo caduco. Whan the malyncholy commyth to hym and he ys fall a downe say these wordes with goode entent yn hys yere [anazapta]. ons or iiij. tymys oþer .iiij. tymys or more
msItem.explicit: 63r Than put hit yn boxis þis medycyne ys trewe
msItem.note: The collection includes a recipe 'ffor to make wyne to turne to wynegre or ale ynto ale eger or syder to asyell' (f. 61v), 'ffor to make verdegrece' (f. 62v), 'ffor to make tryacle' (f. 63r).

msItem.title: Collection medical recipes and charms for animals (especially horses)
msItem.incipit: 63r ffor bytyng of a wode hounde whether hit be man or best. Write the nameys yn swyche thyng as he maye ete + guare + frare + guare + frare + guare + frare + guare + frare + and lett hym ete hit . and he schall be save by the helpe of goode
msItem.explicit: 64v take the barke of the rootes of the same tree and bray them with swynys grece and anoynt them þer with tyll they be hoole.

msItem.title: A recipe and a charm for driving away lice, mice, and rats
msItem.incipit: 64v Propter pulices: Accipe istas iiijor herbas omnes cum radice sua scilicet abcinthium .1. warmode arthemesiam .s. Mogwort hennellam .1. vrticam rubeam sumatur de omnibus equaliter et quo quante in aqua en mundatur domus et lauetur eadem aqua et permitte per [...] diem siccare
msItem.explicit: 65r Accipe iiij.or lapides crete permentaree et scribe illos nomina euangelistarum. Marcus + Matheus + Lucas + Johannes. et super .Johannem. Scribe Alpha. + et oo + et super alios lapides et pone illos .iiij.or lapides super angulos domus cum iiij.or Pater noster

msItem.title: Medical recipes and charms
msItem.incipit: 65r Ad vocem clarificandam. ffurfures ordei in aqua quoque et ipsa aquam bibe
msItem.explicit: 67r And then vnstoppe euery tyme aftewarde and smylle þerto oftyn tymes and stoppe hit a yene

msItem.title: Method for establishing whether the cause for childlessnes in a couple lies with the man or the woman
msItem.rubric: 67r ffor a \wo/man that maye haue no chilryn . yf þou wolte knowe whether the man or woman be yn the defaute
msItem.incipit: 67r Take ij. pottes of erthe . and lett the man pysse yn one of the pottes. and the woman yn the tother and put yn the eþer potte .i. M of bran . and yn toþer as moche bran as the water axyth and lett hit stonde .xvj. dayies
msItem.explicit: 67v And yf hit may nott begete take the principall þat ys so moche as it maye begete þer of etcaetera

msItem.title: Medical recipes
msItem.note: This small grouping includes medical recipes for making 'Pillule arabice probate ad dolorem capitis' and 'Aqua magistralis pro pectore'

msItem.title: The Dome of Uryne Compendium [Expanded Version]
msItem.rubric: 68r Here begynnyth all the syght of waters lokyng Speculum Vrinarum
msItem.incipit: 68r In the begynnyng thow shalt take hede yn specyall to iiij. thynges that longyth to the syght and vnderstondyng of vryn
msItem.explicit: 79v And yf þou see .ij or iij. small skyes . hit betokenyth payne yn the brest of revme and wychede stomake and a bad lyuer and bad lunges

msItem.title: Tract on the four humours in urine
msItem.incipit: 79v Sanguineus: Hys vryn schall be rede coloure and mene thyke yn substance
msItem.explicit: 80r Malencolicus: Hys vryn ys whytt yn coloure and thynne yn substance yolowe or pale

msItem.title: Tract on the four humours
msItem.rubric: 80r De complexionibus
msItem.incipit: 80r Sanguinus: A sanqyn man schall be rede of coloure and mene of stature . amyable meke and mery [crossed out: meke] hardy and bolde syngyng and dawnsyng goode wytt .fatt and rody grete appetyte and moch maye doo
msItem.explicit: 80v Malencolicus: He ys colored lyke clay blakkyst and sum what pale . lytell of stature . dredefull . pensyffe . Soleyne vnstabull Suspecius . moche smyllyng

msItem.title: Medical and cosmetic recipes
msItem.incipit: 80v ffor a bath or a stewe: Take a chyttell or else a cawdron and put yn rennyng water and take hockes and sage an marche lovage . mogwort yvelvys and lauander and boyle all these to geder tyll the sayde erbys be fatt of coloure
msItem.explicit: 84v ffor frekenys yn the visage: Take the blode of a bolle and the blode of a bore all hoote and anoynt the vysage and they schall awaye
msItem.note: The collection also includes recipes 'To make a woman fayre fasyd' (f. 82r), 'ffor to make dereris suett softe' (f. 83r), 'ffor to make gum of an egg' (ff. 84r-84v)

watermark.seg: Folios 1r-46v: Unicorn ( 100 40 ) in the centre of the left margin of the folio.
Folios 47r-78v: Hand with star ( 80 25 ) in the centre of the left margin of the folio.
Folios 79r-83v: Letter P (mirrored) ( 50 25 ) in the centre of the left margin of the folio.

foliation.note: Numbering in pencil in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords written in the lower right-hand corners of the last versos of quires 1, 2, and 4

supportDesc.condition: Damaged outer margins and corners have been repaired with blank conservation paper. Damp stains throughout the manuscript. Two large and two small holes in the leather wrapper.

layout.seg: Ruled in leadpoint, frame only. Single columns. 19-24 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: The manuscript has been copied by a single hand writing in a cursive script with both Anglicana and Secretary features.

additions.p: Medical recipes and short-hand names for recipes added by different (?)16th-century hands in ink to the empty margins, see especially ff. 28v, 45v and 63r.

binding.p: (?)15th-century detached wrapper made from soft rough cut leather.
The manuscript's quires are unbound and kept loose in the wrapper binding.

provenance.p: John ?Chaunce, (fl. late 15th or early 16th century) ?Chaunce, John, late 15th or early 16th century : his ownership inscriptions on f. 62v: 'Iste liber Constat Johannes [? Chauns]'; and f. 84v: 'Johannes [Chaunce] est proprietarius huius liber' (struck through).

Richard Tayler, (fl. late 15th or early 16th century) Tayler, Ricard, late 15th or early 16th century : his ownership inscription on f. 84v: 'Rychard Taylere his bocke / Ho evere in hyme to loke f[...]fynd and houe hyme'.

Hugo (?)Freis (fl. 1534) (?)Freis, Hugo, fl. 1534 : his ownership inscription on f. 84v: 'Hugo (?)Freis clericus est proprietarius huius liber Anno domini .1534.] (struck through). Another hand has erroneously transcribed the year below as '1438'.

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry draws on the description provided by M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of St John's College, Cambridge (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1913).

availability.p: Visitors to St John's College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: St John's College: Old Library and Special Collections.

analytic.title: Uroscopy in Middle English: A Guide to the Texts and Manuscripts

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer, Cambridge University Library
